Hepatitis A is contagious & can harm your liver. Hepatitis A virus is in the poop of people who have the virus. If a person with the virus doesn't wash his or her hands after going to the bathroom, poop can transfer to people, objects, food and drinks. Symptoms You can have hepatitis A for up weeks without feeling sick, but during that time you may be spreading the virus to others.
